column4: What does the name of the distro do in the commands?  when it says like "lucid main"
that refers to the repositories that hold packages/programs.  "Main" is the primary repository that is supported and tested by Ubuntu
you should only use packages from the repos that are designed for a specific release.
for fonts you can find many on the net.. put them in your /home/.fonts directory.. fontmatrix is a good font management program for turning fonts on and off.
